Dear Ms. Williams:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Title Intervention standards.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation During a physical altercation that occurred on 04/04/2025, Staff 1
punched Youth A.
Investigation Complainant was contacted on 04/11/2025 and had no additional
information to provide.
Youth A was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
04/28/2025. He recalled the incident started while inside the
facility. Youth A recalled pushing Staff 1 while she was in the
hallway. He stated the reason he pushed her was because she
was not allowing him to enter back into the unit. He believed she
was trying to slam his fingers in the door and recalled hearing
Supervisor 3 instructing Staff 1 to leave him alone. After Youth A
pushed Staff 1, he recalled Youth B coming over to fight
him. Youth A stated this fight moved outside. Youth A recalled
seeing Staff 1 outside, and he decided to punch her. Staff 1 then
slapped Youth A with something in her hand, and Youth A could
not recall what this was. He believed it was a purse or a
wallet. He was also not sure if she made contact but confirmed
that she swung at his face. Youth A recalled other staff being
around but could not confirm who that was. Youth A believed the
outside incident ended quickly because he AWOL’ed off the
facility grounds.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 04/28/2025. She recalled being called to the situation for a
crisis response. When she arrived the fight between Youth A and
Youth B was outside. As she approached the situation,
Supervisor 1 believed Staff 1 was behind her and on the phone
with law enforcement. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A breaking off
2

and stating that he wanted to fight Staff 1. Youth A was able to
get to Staff 1 and punch her, and Supervisor 1 recalled witnessing
Staff 1 punch him back. Supervisor 1 was not sure if Staff 1 was
successful in punching Youth A in the face. She remarked Staff 1
still had a cellphone in her hands when she did this. Supervisor 1
recalled other staff splitting up Youth A and Staff 1, but she could
not recall who. Supervisor 1 then walked with Staff 1 away from
the situation back inside the main building of the facility.
Supervisor 1 did not recall Staff 1 saying much at that time and
later saw her briefly when Staff 1 was finishing paperwork before
leaving the facility.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 04/30/2025. He recalled being present during the incident in
question. He was not able to recall exactly who attempted to hit
who but recalled Youth A and Staff 1 being escalated and near
each other as the incident occurred. Supervisor 2 did hear
someone state “Why would you do that?” but was not sure who
that was directed to and who said it.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 04/30/2025. Supervisor 3 confirmed she was involved in the
situation as it began inside and then moved outside. She had
heard Youth A talk about wanting to AWOL and wanting to get
other youth to go with him, so she instructed other staff to not let
him back in the unit. Youth A had stated he wanted to get his
shoes and other items to take with him. Supervisor 3 saw Youth A
push Staff 1, and then get into a fight with Youth B. Supervisor 3
recalled this moving outside in front of the unit building. Youth A
then turned his attention away from Youth B and went to Staff
1. Supervisor 3 recalled Youth A attempting to punch Staff
1. Supervisor 3 was not sure if he landed his attempt to punch
her. She then saw Staff 1 swing back at Youth A, and was also
not sure if that attempt to hit was successful. Supervisor 3
believed Staff 1 had something in her hands, possibly her cell
phone. Supervisor 3 then helped move Staff 1 away from the
situation, and she was not sure what occurred with Youth A
next. Supervisor 3 had not seen any behavior of concern from
Staff 1 in the past. She also remarked that she has heard Youth A
state in the past “I am going to get her fired” referring to Staff 1.
Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
04/30/2025. She stated being a part of the incident only when it
was inside the building. Staff 2 saw Youth A push Staff 1, and
before he could do anything else Youth A and Youth B were then
3

trying to fight each other. She believed she heard Staff 1 be
instructed to move away from the situation as it moved outside.
Staff 3 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
04/30/2025. He recalled seeing the incident in question as it
moved outside of the unit building. Staff 3 stated he did not see
either Youth A or Staff 1 hit each other, despite all the commotion
going on.
Clinical Supervisor was interviewed over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1 on 04/30/2025. She recalled coming to the incident as it
had moved outside of the unit building. She denied seeing any
specific assaultive behavior between Youth A and Staff 1. When
she arrived she witnessed Supervisor 3 moving Staff 1 away from
the situation. She recalled being with Youth A after the incident
occurred, and hearing him confirm he pushed and tried to hit Staff
1 and also stating “That doesn’t mean she can hit me.”
Youth B was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
04/30/2025. He recalled fighting with Youth A while inside
because he did not believe Youth B should have been pushing a
female staff. He recalled following Youth A outside and
attempting to fight him again. Youth B saw Youth A hit Staff 1 in
the face twice while she was on the phone with law
enforcement. He could not recall if she attempted to hit
him. Youth B commented he was under the influence as this
occurred and that could have affected his memory. Youth B was
interviewed by Licensing Consultant 2 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit to the facility on 05/29/2025. He clarified that he
still remembered the incident in question despite admitting to
being high on marijuana at that time. He stated getting access to
marijuana while he was AWOLed earlier in the day and denied
that he got it from staff or anywhere related to the facility and
denied bringing any of it back to the facility.
Staff 4 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
04/30/2025. He recalled being on another unit and coming to the
situation because of a crisis call. He arrived when Youth A and
Youth B were fighting outside. He then saw Youth A go after Staff
1, attempting to punch her. Staff 4 could not recall if Staff 1
attempted to hit Youth A back, but did recall that another staff
member assisted in getting Staff 1 away from the situation.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone on 05/08/2025. She
recalled the incident in question beginning because she was
attempting to prevent Youth A from AWOL’ing. She was
4

concerned Youth A would also attempt to get other youth to
AWOL with him as that had occurred recently. As Staff 1 was
communicating with another staff about how to handle the
situation, she tried to keep the door to the unit closed. Youth A
got upset and threatened her. Staff 1 recalled Youth A pushing
her, and almost immediately Youth B began to fight Youth A. She
recalled trying to call law enforcement to get assistance for the
situation, and as she did so both Youth A and Youth B moved
outside of the building. Staff 1 moved outside the building as well
as she was speaking with local dispatch. As she was doing so
Youth A approached her and tried to hit her. Staff 1 recalled this
part of the incident as very chaotic, and it was hard to place who
was around her. She believed Youth A hitting her could have
been avoided if others had kept Youth A away from her. Staff 1
denied attempting to hit Youth A back as this occurred. She
stated she could not have done so because she had her phone in
one hand and an envelope in the other. She believed she was
able to block his attempt to hit her with her forearm. Staff 1
recalled Staff 5 being right next to her and being able to move
Youth A away from her. As this occurred Staff 1 moved away
from the situation and went to the main building of the facility.
Staff 5 was interviewed over the phone on 05/13/2025. He
recalled being involved in the incident when it had moved
outside. Staff 5 recalled a “scuffle” between Youth A and Staff 1,
and he attempted to move Youth A away from Staff 1. He could
not recall if Youth A or Staff 1 attempted to hit each other, but he
knew Youth A was capable of doing so.
Therapist 1 was interviewed over the phone on 05/13/2025. She
recalled coming to the incident after it had moved outside of the
unit building. Therapist 1 was walking up to the group of people
when she saw Youth A hit Staff 1. This occurred at least once but
stated it could have been multiple hits in a quick
succession. Therapist 1 saw Staff 1 hit Youth A back. She
believed this occurred once. Therapist 1 recalled Staff 1 having a
phone in one hand and an envelope in another, and she believed
Staff 1 hit Youth A back with the hand holding the
envelope. Therapist 1 recalled seeing Youth A be moved away by
Staff 5 after this, and she did not believe he made any more
attempts to get to Staff 1. Therapist 1 believed Staff 1 moved
away from the situation, and she did not see Staff 1 after that point
in time. Therapist 1 recalled speaking with Youth A about the
situation. Youth A had described the incident to her, admitting
that he had pushed and hit Staff 1 and stating that she tried to hit
him back.
5

Video reviewed:
• Security camera footage dated 04/04/2025 beginning at
5:07 pm was viewed. This footage is located on the
exterior of the main building of the facility and faces the
exterior doors of the unit building. Several individuals could
be seen outside of the unit building, with multiple others
moving from the main building to them. Because of the
distance away from the individuals it could not be
determined who was who. After approximately ten seconds
there appears to be a brief physical struggle and two
individuals begin to walk away from the others and back
towards the main building. It could not be determined who
these individuals were. It could not be determined if any
individuals assaulted another from the footage.
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility policy titled “Physical Intervention Policy” was
provided and reviewed. This policy and procedure stated
that any hitting or striking of youth by staff is a prohibited
act.
• Incident report documentation dated 04/04/2025 from the
facility was provided and reviewed.
o Documentation authored by Supervisor 1 stated that
Youth A walked up to Staff 1 and punched her in the
face. Youth A tried to pull away from another
unidentified staff to continue to be aggressive. Staff
1 then punched Youth A in response. They were
immediately separated.
o Documentation authored by Supervisor 3 stated that
Youth A pushed Staff 1 while inside the unit
building. Staff 1 was instructed to go outside as
Youth B then started to fight Youth A. When Youth
A also moved outside, he then ran up to Staff 1 and
hit her. Supervisor 3 described Staff 1 as “swinging
papers” that were in her hand, and it was unclear
what she swung at.
• Incident report documentation dated 04/04/2025 from the
facility was provided and reviewed, and this corroborated
Youth B’s account of his AWOL prior to the incident in
question. Upon his return he denied any review from
medical staff.
• Nursing notes from the facility were provided. On
04/04/2025 it was documented nursing staff saw Youth
A. His face was red but there was no bruising at that
time. The back of his left ear was cut open. It was
6

assessed that stitches would not be needed and Youth A
received treatment from the nursing staff.
• Incident report documentation from local law enforcement
was received, dated 04/04/2025. Law enforcement
reported to the facility and documented Youth A punched
Staff 1, and Staff 1 proceeded to punch Youth A back as a
reaction.
• Staff 1’s personnel record was reviewed. At the time of the
incident, she did not have any disciplinary action on her
file. She had been trained most recently on 02/13/2025 in
the facility’s restraint model and physical management
policies and procedures.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation reviewed Staff 1 attempted to hit
Youth A after Youth A hit her during the incident that occurred on
04/04/2025.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Title Intervention standards.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to
a youth's background or appearance or mental state.
Yelling, threats, ridicule, or humiliation are strictly
prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 used inappropriate language towards Youth A during the
incident that occurred on 04/04/2025.
7

Investigation Youth A was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
04/28/2025. Youth A did not recall any specific statements that
Staff 1 made during the incident and was not able to state if she
had yelled at him or not as he was fighting Youth B and attempted
to hit Staff 1.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 04/28/2025. Supervisor 1 was not able to recall if Staff 1
yelled or used inappropriate language at Youth A during the
incident.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 04/30/2025. He recalled being present during the incident in
question. Supervisor 2 recalled hearing staff yell “stop” at Youth A
as he was fighting Youth B and attempting to hit Staff 1 but could
not recall who this came from. Supervisor 2 did not hear Staff 1
yell or swear at Youth A.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 04/28/2025. During the part of the incident that occurred
outside, she recalled hearing Staff 1 state to Youth A “Don’t you
fucking touch me” and “Did you hit me?” She recalled Staff 1
yelling these statements at Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
04/28/2025. She did not recall hearing Staff 1 say anything of
note during the part of the incident she witnessed.
Staff 3 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
04/30/2025. He stated that he did not hear Staff 1 yell or swear at
Youth A during the incident.
Clinical Supervisor was interviewed over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1 on 04/30/2025. She recalled seeing Supervisor 3
moving Staff 1 away from the situation. As this was occurring Staff
1 was yelling back at Youth A. Clinical Supervisor could not recall
what Staff 1 said at that time.
Youth B was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
04/30/2025. He recalled never hearing any inappropriate
comments or yelling from Staff 1 during the incident in question.
Staff 4 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
04/30/2025. He recalled a lot of yelling going on during the
situation but could not specify anything specific Staff 1 said during
the incident.
8

Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone on 05/08/2025. She
denied swearing at Youth A during the incident. She recalled
Youth A yelling threatening things at her, including “Bitch, move
before I hit you.” She recalled saying to Youth A “What is wrong?”
and “Why are you hitting me?” Staff 1 stated she had to yell at
Youth A to get his attention. She also recalled previous times
when Youth A had stated to her “I’m going to get you fired.”
Staff 5 was interviewed over the phone on 05/13/2025. He did
not recall if Staff 1 was yelling or swearing at Youth A during the
incident. Staff 5 remembered there being a lot of escalated voices
because of the chaotic nature of the incident, but could not
attribute those to any specific person.
Therapist 1 was interviewed over the phone on 05/13/2025. She
recalled hearing lots of yelling and screaming as Youth A hit Staff
1, but could not state who this came from. She did not believe
she heard any swearing or inappropriate language of any
kind. She believed she heard Staff 1 state something to the effect
of “I’m going to lose my job” as she was walking away from the
situation.
Video reviewed:
• The video footage of the incident did not capture any audio.
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility policy titled “Physical Intervention Policy” was
provided and reviewed. This policy and procedure stated
that verbal abuse of youth by staff was prohibited, including
any yelling or use of derogatory language.
• Incident report documentation dated 04/04/2025 from the
facility was provided and reviewed. Both Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor 3 wrote separate incident reports and neither
detailed anything regarding yelling or cussing on the part of
Staff 1.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as 11 or 12 persons
interviewed denied hearing Staff 1 use inappropriate language
towards Youth A including Youth A and Staff 1.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
9

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
